conclusion: To predict which container (D, E, or F) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles, let's analyze the flow paths.
Liquid flows from A, B, and C.
The baffles direct the flow downward.
The orientation of the purple and brown baffle guides the flow toward the right side.
The green baffle directs some of the flow to the left.
The combined flow from the green, purple, and brown baffles directs the liquid primarily into container F.
Therefore, the liquid will flow into container F.
